lead_paragraph: The country’s government is coming under criticism after the death of a journalist imprisoned under a new law that criminalizes offending the president.

byline.contributor: Amir Jalal Zerdoumi contributed reporting from Algiers.

headline.print_headline: Death of a Journalist Stirs Anger in Algeria
headline.main: Harsh Facebook Posts, Jail and Now Death: A Man’s Fate Angers Algeria

snippet: The country’s government is coming under criticism after the death of a journalist imprisoned under a new law that criminalizes offending the president....
abstract: Algerian government is receiving heavy criticism over death of freelance British-Algerian journalist Mohamed Tamalt, who died in prison while serving two-year sentence for insulting Pres Abdelaziz Bouteflika; Tamalt's death is embarrassment for authoritarian government, and his imprisonment sheds light on pressures embattled government is placing on independent news media.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
